DataElement.preferredName: Invasive Lobular Breast Carcinoma Histologic Classification Subtype Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The histologic subtype for an infiltrating lobular carcinoma of the breast.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Invasive Lobular Breast Carcinoma Histologic Classification Subtype
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: An infiltrating lobular adenocarcinoma of the breast.  The malignant cells lack cohesion and are arranged individually or in a linear manner (Indian files), or as narrow trabeculae within the stroma.  The malignant cells are usually smaller than those of ductal carcinoma, are less pleomorphic, and have fewer mitotic figures._Pertaining to the combined microscopic physical features of cells and their surrounding extracellular environment in tissues._A method of generalization, the systematic arrangement of entities into classes or groups based on mutual similarity and certain differing characteristics._A group forming a type within a larger type.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An infiltrating lobular adenocarcinoma of the breast.  The malignant cells lack cohesion and are arranged individually or in a linear manner (Indian files), or as narrow trabeculae within the stroma.  The malignant cells are usually smaller than those of ductal carcinoma, are less pleomorphic, and have fewer mitotic figures.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Specification of human conditions relevant to cancer. This includes observations, test results, history, and other concepts relevant to characterization of human cancer-related conditions. Non-neoplastic conditions of interest are also included.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Invasive Lobular Breast Carcinoma, Alveolar Variant

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Invasive Lobular Breast Carcinoma, Alveolar Variant
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A grade I invasive lobular carcinoma of the breast, characterized by the presence of round groups of neoplastic cells.

Concepts.longName: Invasive Breast Lobular Carcinoma, Alveolar Variant
Concepts.definition: A grade I invasive lobular carcinoma of the breast, characterized by the presence of round groups of neoplastic cells.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An infiltrating lobular adenocarcinoma.  The malignant cells lack cohesion and are arranged individually or in a linear manner (Indian files), or as narrow trabeculae within the stroma.  The malignant cells are usually smaller than those of ductal carcinoma, are less pleomorphic, and have fewer mitotic figures. --2002

Concepts.definition: An infiltrating lobular adenocarcinoma of the breast.  The malignant cells lack cohesion and are arranged individually or in a linear manner (Indian files), or as narrow trabeculae within the stroma.  The malignant cells are usually smaller than those of ductal carcinoma, are less pleomorphic, and have fewer mitotic figures.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Invasive Lobular Breast Carcinoma, Pleomorphic Variant

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Invasive Lobular Breast Carcinoma, Pleomorphic Variant
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A grade II invasive lobular carcinoma of the breast, characterized by the presence of neoplastic cells with large and atypical nuclei.

Concepts.longName: Invasive Breast Lobular Carcinoma, Pleomorphic Variant
Concepts.definition: A grade II invasive lobular carcinoma of the breast, characterized by the presence of neoplastic cells with large and atypical nuclei.
